sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true declaration of the estate of the colonie in Virginia vvith a confutation of such scandalous reports as haue tended to the disgrace of so worthy an enterprise. Published by aduise and direction of the Councell of Virginia. Counseil for Virginia (England and Wales)
[4], 68 p.
Printed [by Eliot's Court Press and William Stansby] for William Barret, and are to be sold [by Edward Blount] at the blacke Beare in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1610.
Printer's and bookseller's names from STC and addendum. "Eliot's Court Press pr[inted]. A-1st F; Stansby the rest". The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A". Running title reads: A true declaration of Virginia. Reproduction of the original in the New York Public Library.
=======

[4], 68 p.
Printed [by Eliot's Court Press and William Stansby] for William Barret, and are to be sold [by Edward Blount] at the blacke Beare in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1610.
Printer's and bookseller's names from STC and addendum. "Eliot's Court Press pr[inted]. A-1st F; Stansby the rest". The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A". Running title reads: A true declaration of Virginia. Reproduction of the original in the New York Public Library.
